title: Renouf Atoni
text:
Renouf Atoni ("<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">né</a>" To'omaga; born 25 June 1995) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>. He previously played for the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a>.
Background.
Atoni was born in <a href="Porirua">Porirua</a>, New Zealand. He is of <a href="Samoans">Samoan</a> (through Mother) and <a href="Tokelau">Tokelau</a>an (through Father) descent.
His junior club was the <a href="Porirua%20Vikings">Porirua Vikings</a>.
Playing career.
2018.
Atoni made his <a href="NRL">NRL</a> debut in Round 10 2018 against the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a>.
On September 23 2018, Atoni was part of the Canterbury side which defeated Newtown 18-12 in the 2018 <a href="Intrust%20Super%20Premiership%20NSW">Intrust Super Premiership NSW</a> grand final. The following week, To'omaga was part of the Canterbury side which defeated <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> winners Redcliffe 42-18 in the <a href="NRL%20State%20Championship">NRL State Championship</a> final.
2019.
On 6 May 2019, Atoni was named in the <a href="Canterbury%20Cup%20NSW">Canterbury Cup NSW</a> residents team to play against the Queensland residents side.
2020.
In round 2 of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>, he scored his first try in the <a href="NRL">NRL</a> as Canterbury-Bankstown were defeated by <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland</a> 24-16 in front of an empty <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>.
He made a total of 16 appearances for Canterbury in the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>. The club finished in 15th place on the table, only avoiding the <a href="Wooden%20Spoon%20%28award%29">Wooden Spoon</a> by for and against.
2021.
In July 2021, Atoni signed a contract to join the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Sydney Roosters</a> starting in 2022.
